intro: Fagara inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal fagara, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in countries like Mexico, Guatemala, and Honduras. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a glossy appearance with serrated edges. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and produce a fragrant scent to attract pollinators.
